adjectives.description: disorderly (comparative more disorderly, superlative most disorderly)

entries.meaning: Not in order; marked by disorder or disarray.
examples: The books and papers are in a disorderly state.

entries.meaning: Not acting in an orderly way, as the functions of the body or mind.
Not complying with the restraints of order and law; unruly; lawless.
(law) Offensive to good morals and public decency.

adverbs.description: disorderly (comparative more disorderly, superlative most disorderly)

entries.meaning: In a confused or lawless manner.
A person who acts in a disorderly manner.
examples: The police are allowed one shilling a-head upon all disorderlies who are discharged by the magistrates upon payment of expenses. The number so discharged are about a third of the number in custody.
